Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.name: appDisplayName
Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.abstract: The app name, as a string. It is required, and “ERROR” is returned if it is not present.

Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.name: appVersionString
Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.abstract: The app version, as a string. It is required, and “ERROR” is returned if it is not present.

Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.name: appVersionBuildString
Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.abstract: The build version, as a string. It is required, and “ERROR” is returned if it is not present.

Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.name: copyrightString
Extensions/Bundle.html#/s:So8NSBundleC8I.abstract: If there is a copyright string, it is returned here. It may be nil.

Extensions/Bundle.html.name: Bundle
Extensions/Bundle.html.abstract: This extension adds a few simple accessors for some of the more common bundle items.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html.name: StringProtocol
Extensions/StringProtocol.html.abstract: We add a computed property that allows us to easily localize (main bundle, Localizable.strings).

Classes/ITCB_Base_WindowController.html#.name: windowDidLoad()
Classes/ITCB_Base_WindowController.html#.abstract: This accounts for a bug in Xcode, where the restorable flag is ignored. If you set the name here, it will restore.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: storyboardID
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: The stroryboard ID, for instantiating the class.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: uuid
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is here to satisfy the SDK Peripheral Observer requirement.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: workingWithQuestion
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is a semaphore that prevents questions from “piling up.” If a question has not yet been answered, this is true.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: questionAskedLabel
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This displays the question from the Central.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: sendRandomButton
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: If the user hits this button, a random answer will be selected and sent.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: containerScrollView
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is the container scroll view for the table.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: tableView
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: The question picker table view.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: busyView
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This displays a “waiting for question” screen.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: waitingLabel
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is the “waiting” label.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: waitingActivityIndicator
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is an activity spinner.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: sendRandomButtonHit(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called when the user clicks the “Send Random” button.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: displayQuestion(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called to display the question.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: setUI(showItems:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This either shows or hides the “waiting” screen, or the answer handlers.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called when the view has completed loading.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: viewWillAppear()
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called just before the view appears. We use this to register as an observer.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: viewWillDisappear()
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called just before the view disappears. We use this to un-register as an observer.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: numberOfRows(in:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called to supply the number of rows in the table.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: tableView(_:objectValueFor:row:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is called to supply the string display for one row that corresponds to a device.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: tableViewSelectionDidChange(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called after a table row was selected by the user.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: questionAskedByDevice(_:question:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is called when a Central asks a Peripheral a question.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: answerSentToDevice(_:answer:toQuestion:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This is called when a Peripheral successfully answers a Central’s question.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: errorOccurred(_:sdk:)
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: Called when an error condition is encountered by the SDK.

Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.abstract: Called when the view has completed loading.

Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.name: selectCentralMode(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.abstract: Called when the user selects the “CENTRAL” button.

Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.name: selectPeripheralMode(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.abstract: Called when the user selects the “PERIPHERAL” button.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.name: appDelegate
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is a shortcut to get the app delegate instance.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.name: deviceSDKInstance
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.abstract: This will allow access to the singleton SDK instance as a generic SDK. This can return nil, if the SDK is not loaded.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.name: getDeviceSDKInstanceAsCentral
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.abstract: This will allow access to the singleton SDK instance as a Central SDK. This will return nil, if the SDK is not a Central.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.name: getDeviceSDKInstanceAsPeripheral
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.abstract: This will allow access to the singleton SDK instance as a Peripheral SDK. This will return nil, if the SDK is not a Peripheral.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/c.name: viewDidAppear()
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/c.abstract: Called when the view is about to appear.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.name: setWindowTitle()
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.abstract: This sets the window title to whatever the view controller title happens to be.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.name: displayAlert(header:message:)
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html#/s.abstract: This displays a simple alert, with an OK button.

Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.name: mainLabel
Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This is the main app name/version label, at the top.

Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.name: seriesURIButton
Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This button allows the user to go to the series in their browser.

Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.name: githubURIButton
Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This button allows the user to go to the GitHub repo in their browser.

Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.name: uriButtonHit(_:)
Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.abstract: This is called when a URI button is hit. It parses the URI from the button name, and goes there.

Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/ITCB_About_ViewController.html#/.abstract: Called when the view has completed loading.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: Reference to the device instance for this controller.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.name: answerLabel
Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: The label that will display the returned answer.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.name: sendQuestion(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: Called when the user hits the “SEND QUESTION” button, or ENTER while editing the text.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: Called when the view has completed loading.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.name: viewWillAppear()
Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: Called just before the view appears. We use this to register as an observer.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: Called when text changes in the Text Field.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.name: questionAnsweredByDevice(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: This is called when a Peripheral returns an answer to the Central.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.name: questionAskedOfDevice(_:)
Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: This is called when a Central successfully asks a question of a peripheral.

Classes/ITCB_Central_Peripheral_Device_V.abstract: Called when an error condition is encountered by the SDK.

Classes/ITCB_CENTRAL_Initial_ViewControl.abstract: This is here to satisfy the SDK Central Observer requirement.

Classes/ITCB_CENTRAL_Initial_ViewControl.abstract: Called when the view has completed loading.

Classes/ITCB_CENTRAL_Initial_ViewControl.abstract: Called just before the view disappears. We use this to un-register as an observer.

Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@ITCB.name: quitMenuItem

Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/s:8ITCB_M.name: appDelegate
Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/s:8ITCB_M.abstract: This is a shortcut to get the app delegate instance as an instance of this class.

Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/s:8ITCB_M.name: displayAlert(header:message:)
Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/s:8ITCB_M.abstract: This displays a simple alert, with an OK button.

Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/s:8ITCB_M.abstract: This unwinds our error report by parsing it for associated values.

Classes/ITCB_AppDelegate.html#/c:@M@ITCB.abstract: Called when the app has finished its launch setup.

Classes/ITCB_CENTRAL_Initial_ViewControl.name: ITCB_CENTRAL_Initial_ViewController
Classes/ITCB_CENTRAL_Initial_ViewControl.abstract: This view controller is loaded over the mode selection, as we have decided to be a Central.

Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html.name: ITCB_Base_ViewController
Classes/ITCB_Base_ViewController.html.abstract: This is a base class for all the view controllers in the app, and takes care of some common housekeeping stuff.

Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.name: ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewController
Classes/ITCB_Mode_Selection_ViewControll.abstract: This is the first screen that is shown upon startup. It allows the user to select an operating mode for the app.

Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.name: ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController
Classes/ITCB_Peripheral_ViewController.h.abstract: This view controller is loaded over the mode selection, as we have decided to be a Peripheral.

Classes/ITCB_Base_WindowController.html.name: ITCB_Base_WindowController
Classes/ITCB_Base_WindowController.html.abstract: The main reason for creating this class was to allow us to interpret settings, and to fix an issue with Interface Builder.
